intro: Lippia gardneriana, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray foliage and clusters of small blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas. It has a compact growth habit and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening for its ornate appearance. The leaves and flowers are used in traditional medicine and for making teas.
